comment: Buttery toffee aroma, some vanilla. Nose is rich and strong. Sweet on the tongue with some dry woodsy notes. Finish is smooth.
Great japanese whiskey. Better than either 18 yr suntory or hibiki. Subtle initial smokiness of islay with a highland-esque finish. Lagavuilin lite with a balvenie finish.
smooth start with mild peaty finish
Some smoke on the nose- nice tribute to scotch
Syrupy, grapes. Hint of citrus. Sweet on palate with a surprisingly clean finish. Hint of cinnamon
A bit weak in flavor profile. Not as peaty as I'd like; spicy and lightly smoky
Heavy floral and cocoa on the nose. Sweet fruit, floral and bit of an apple cider on the taste. Needs a bit of water to activate the flavour.
Smells amazing carmelly! A bit sharp at first but changes nicely
Reminds me of Cragganmore. smokier than the 17.

Demerara sugar on the nose, reminding me of the El Dorado 12 rum. Once tasted, you'll get some spice to remind you it's a whiskey. Smooth and lingering finish. A solid introduction into Japanese whiskey.
Puissant , pas non plus transcendant ... 32€ a carrefour
Fairly fruity aromas of apples, grapes. Flavors of fruit, caramel apples, spice, with a touch of smoke, nicely balanced.

It's kinda herbal, maybe a little fruit, but herbal. It's a bit sweet and oily, malty, maybe a little sherry character, but... the Yoichi in it makes itself known. It's got that Yoichi funkiness in it. Not a terribly distinct finish. It's pleasant enough, and Nikka is a lot easier to find than any of the three Suntory brands. Give it a try.
Wonderfully Complex.  A bit more peat and a little less sweet than the Yamazaki 12, but still perfectly balanced.

If you've had Japanese malts before, like the Yamazaki or Hibiki, you'll find this quite different.  It's not peaty, but does have a hint of smoke---more like charcoal.  The aroma is weak, but the palette is quite strong with the floral charcoal mix.  Finish is quite short.   Not bad for the price, and quite different than others from Japan
Had this last night.  Waste of money.  Bland and boring.  No depth or complexity.
My first Japanese whisky. Very nice nose - maple, peat, flowery. Peat flavor borders on soapy at first but finishes nicely. A little water helps

Not a complex whiskey but amazingly super smooth. great for casual drink. 

Take 2 : honey peach and maybe lychee in the nose and balanced sweetness on the palate with cinnamon spices but mostly honey and fruits
lacks complexity but super smooth. mild scotch.
This was quite good. Looking forward to trying more from Nikka
The only Japanese whisky at Pijiu Belly.
Good enough, simple, a bit too sweet.

Got this from an artisan shop in Oakland and chose to try it before the coffey. It is so good! Smooth and on nose and initial pallet, then it catches on. I love it. Definitely fits in the world of my glenlivet and glennfiddich.
Am I dreaming, smells like Sake ?
Clean. Low body and bite, but a nice warming.
Smoother than single pure malt with a smoky end.
A real step up from the NAS Taketsuru. A lot of plum wine and maple on the nose with a rich, buttered cinnamon palate and spicy finish with just a hint of smoke.

Nose - Light honeyed pears and white donut peaches (subtle), hint of fresh hay, background of fresh longan, very subtle floral. Complex, quite nice.
Taste - A honey cereal-like sweetness, faint, very light gentle smokiness from the peated Yoichi component, hint of black pepper spiciness, diluted dried longan black tea.
Finish - Sweetness fades fairly quickly, but leaves a taste of a drying longan black tea sweetness with a faint tail end of black pepper, pear, and floral honey.
89/100
This on the third sip has shown up on my chest and shoulders and back of head. Extremely thankful that I found this at a little sushi place on Westerplatte in Kraków.
If I can find it at a fair price, I'll buy it.
It's soft and white a good pure it's fantastic

Tried this at The Farm in Byron Bay as a nightcap after dinner and a few froths. Tricked a kid into thinking a fake horse was more like a real horse. Good flavours, clean tasting, balanced, not overly sweet. Nice stuff
dry smell, sweet hint of caramel and a bouquet of flowers. smooth, thick mouth feel, slight hint of pepper at the finish.
Tried this at a tasting in a place that still has this and it was great. Fruity and smoky.
Lightly smoky on the nose. Alcohol bite on the finish. Several things going on there, can’t distinguish. (Just ate)
Smooth and savory with a light amount of smoke. A hint of sweetness at the front with a crisp finish. Very good.

Fyldig, karamelisert whisky med rund kropp og toner av hickory, karamell og toffee med en meget rund og søtlig kropp. Fin fast avslutning. Maltdrevet og veldig lang. Mangler litt nyanser, men meget lett å like.
Good but not my forte. Peat/smoke doesn’t have great flavor balance IMO. But I’m always weird about peat. 3.5 stars. Prefer the standard Nikka Pure Malt

Interesting. More to follow as I experiment with this more. So far, this has potential. 

Tried it neat and on ice with a drop of Vermont maple syrup.
malt vanilla smooth orange honey light
